response.overview: Ballet for TV by Flemming Flindt and Eugène Ionesco with music by Thomas Koppel played by Savage Rose. First broadcast in 1971.  The ballet was first performed by the Danish Royal Ballet, first as a TV show on the Danish public service channel called DR in 1971, then as a performance at the Danish Royal Theatre in 1972. The main part was danced by Vivi Flindt, and Flemming Flindt also starred. The ballet caused quite a stir, partly because of its spectacular nude dancing, but also the catchy music, published both complete on vinyl (which double-lp) and in abbreviated form on vinyl and CD.
response.title: Dødens Triumf

release_dates.note: Transmission fra Det kongelige Teater af Flemmings Flindts dansedrama efter Eugéne Ionesco. Musik af Thomas Koppel indspillet af Savage Rose.

results.name: The Savage Rose - Dødens Triumf (full album) 1972
